page.title: 02Eppleby Village MT
page.content: In Eppleby village there are 93 {houses}and 2{pubs.}The pubs' names are The Travellers Rest and the Cross Keys. There is one post office, a shop, a village hall, a blacksmith, a craft centre, a riding centre and a police house. There are two{greens}and a bus shelter is on one of the greens. Most{houses}are made of stone. Most brick houses were built about one hundred years ago. More people own houses than rent them. Half of the houses don't have garages. Some of the houses are holiday homes. In 1881 there was 471{people}but in 1981 there were only 230 people living in Eppleby because some of the houses are empty and there are smaller families living in the houses.
